revised_title: Charles Garrett Phillips: A Pioneering Figure in Medicine and Anaesthetics
tldr: Charles Garrett Phillips was a prominent figure in the field of medicine and anaesthetics. Born into a medical family, he was influenced by his father, a senior anaesthetist, who introduced him to the world of science and medicine. Phillips pursued his education at Magdalen College, Oxford, and St Bartholomew's Hospital, where he made significant contributions to the field of anaesthesia. His innovations, such as the Phillips airway, continue to be relevant today. Phillips' life and work are celebrated in this biographical memoir.
